ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Have Prices gotten out of hand
ygData.msgSnippet: Geez you guys...  Try and get into a cooperative, team-spirited guild.  I logged on last night and had two different guildmates send me tells saying they had
ygData.messageBody:
Geez you guys... Try and get into a cooperative, team-spirited guild. I
logged on last night and had two different guildmates send me tells saying
they had some Singing Steel boots for me if I still needed them.

[51 Minstrel] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work


> Slyde wrote:
> >Last night a 51 Wizard from my guild mentioned that he had a friend
> (non-Bard) selling singing armor. I asked him what the guy wanted
> per piece and he said 8K. I think this is absolutetly outragoes. I
> mentioned to my wiz that I heard on this list some people mentioned
> 5k-6k and others even 1.5-2. He said he thought prices were higher
> on Xegony than other servers.
>
> I've heard outrageous demands (5 - 8k) for Singing Steel as well. I
> just wish them luck in selling it and try not to LMAO to them
> directly. :) I was lucky to receive boots from a guildmember as a
> gift (I feel so twinked! :) but I would not pay 5k for either gaunts
> or boots. There aren't THAT many Bards out there to keep the price
> that high, even if some are naive enough to pay it. I'd pay 1.5 -
> 2k, maybe as high as 2.5k if I go long enough without (or I'm
> planning a trip to Kedge). Otherwise, I'll wait until I can get them
> myself, or am able to loot some Imbrued. (I finally have a large
> enough buffer in 47 to tempt me to Hate next trip I am invited on :)
>
> BTW, I sold my Lambent Boots for 400 pp. I would think 5 X that
> price is reasonable for the Singing.
>
> Darkfox Reven'tsol
> Xegony
